com.pb.sawdust.util.format

Enum TextFormat.Conversion

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<TextFormat.Conversion>
      • com.pb.sawdust.util.format.TextFormat.Conversion
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<TextFormat.Conversion>
    Enclosing class:
    TextFormat

    public static enum TextFormat.Conversion
extends java.lang.Enum<TextFormat.Conversion>
    The Conversion enum defines all of the possible text format conversions available to TextFormat instances.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      BOOLEAN
      If the argument is null, then the result is "false".
      BOOLEAN_UPPER_CASE
      If the argument is null, then the result is "FALSE".
      CHARACTER
      The argument is formatted as a Unicode character.
      CHARACTER_UPPER_CASE
      The argument is formatted as an upper-case Unicode character.
      DATE_TIME
      The argument is formatted as a date and/or time, depending on the specified DateTimeConversion.
      DATE_TIME_UPPER_CASE
      The argument is formatted as an upper-case date and/or time, depending on the specified DateTimeConversion.
      FLOATING_POINT
      The argument is formatted as a decimal number.
      FLOATING_POINT_HEXADECIMAL
      The argument is formatted as a hexadecimal floating-point number with a significand and an exponent.
      FLOATING_POINT_HEXADECIMAL_UPPER_CASE
      The argument is formatted as an upper-case hexadecimal floating-point number with a significand and an exponent.
      FLOATING_POINT_OR_SCIENTIFIC
      The argument is formatted using computerized scientific notation or decimal format, depending on the precision and the value after rounding.
      FLOATING_POINT_OR_SCIENTIFIC_UPPER_CASE
      The argument is formatted using computerized scientific notation (using an upper-case "E") or decimal format, depending on the precision and the value after rounding.
      HASH_CODE
      If the argument is null, then the result is "NULL".
      HASH_CODE_UPPER_CASE
      If the argument is null, then the result is "null".
      INTEGER
      The argument is formatted as a decimal integer.
      INTEGER_HEXADECIMAL
      The argument is formatted as a hexadecimal integer.
      INTEGER_HEXADECIMAL_UPPER_CASE
      The argument is formatted as an upper-case hexadecimal integer.
      INTEGER_OCTAL
      The argument is formatted as an octal integer.
      NEW_LINE
      The result is the platform-specific line separator.
      PERCENT
      The result is a literal "%" (\\u0025).
      SCIENTIFIC
      The argument is formatted as a decimal number in computerized scientific notation.
      SCIENTIFIC_UPPER_CASE
      The argument is formatted as a decimal number in computerized scientific notation using an upper-case "E".
      STRING
      If the argument is null, then the result is "NULL".
      STRING_UPPER_CASE
      If the argument is null, then the result is "NULL".

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • BOOLEAN

        public static final TextFormat.Conversion BOOLEAN
        If the argument is null, then the result is "false". If arg is a boolean or Boolean, then the result is the string returned by String.valueOf(argument). Otherwise, the result is "true".

      • BOOLEAN_UPPER_CASE

        public static final TextFormat.Conversion BOOLEAN_UPPER_CASE
        If the argument is null, then the result is "FALSE". If arg is a boolean or Boolean, then the result is the string returned by String.valueOf(argument).toUpperCase(). Otherwise, the result is "TRUE".

      • HASH_CODE

        public static final TextFormat.Conversion HASH_CODE
        If the argument is null, then the result is "NULL". Otherwise, the result is obtained by invoking Integer.toHexString(argument.hashCode()).

      • HASH_CODE_UPPER_CASE

        public static final TextFormat.Conversion HASH_CODE_UPPER_CASE
        If the argument is null, then the result is "null". Otherwise, the result is obtained by invoking Integer.toHexString(argument.hashCode()).toiUpperCase().

      • STRING

        public static final TextFormat.Conversion STRING
        If the argument is null, then the result is "NULL". If argument implements Formattable, then arg.formatTo is invoked. Otherwise, the result is obtained by invoking arg.toString().

      • STRING_UPPER_CASE

        public static final TextFormat.Conversion STRING_UPPER_CASE
        If the argument is null, then the result is "NULL". If argument implements Formattable, then arg.formatTo is invoked. Otherwise, the result is obtained by invoking arg.toString().toUpperCase().

      • CHARACTER

        public static final TextFormat.Conversion CHARACTER
        The argument is formatted as a Unicode character.

      • CHARACTER_UPPER_CASE

        public static final TextFormat.Conversion CHARACTER_UPPER_CASE
        The argument is formatted as an upper-case Unicode character.

      • INTEGER

        public static final TextFormat.Conversion INTEGER
        The argument is formatted as a decimal integer.

      • INTEGER_OCTAL

        public static final TextFormat.Conversion INTEGER_OCTAL
        The argument is formatted as an octal integer.

      • INTEGER_HEXADECIMAL

        public static final TextFormat.Conversion INTEGER_HEXADECIMAL
        The argument is formatted as a hexadecimal integer.

      • INTEGER_HEXADECIMAL_UPPER_CASE

        public static final TextFormat.Conversion INTEGER_HEXADECIMAL_UPPER_CASE
        The argument is formatted as an upper-case hexadecimal integer.

      • SCIENTIFIC

        public static final TextFormat.Conversion SCIENTIFIC
        The argument is formatted as a decimal number in computerized scientific notation.

      • SCIENTIFIC_UPPER_CASE

        public static final TextFormat.Conversion SCIENTIFIC_UPPER_CASE
        The argument is formatted as a decimal number in computerized scientific notation using an upper-case "E".

      • FLOATING_POINT

        public static final TextFormat.Conversion FLOATING_POINT
        The argument is formatted as a decimal number.

      • FLOATING_POINT_OR_SCIENTIFIC

        public static final TextFormat.Conversion FLOATING_POINT_OR_SCIENTIFIC
        The argument is formatted using computerized scientific notation or decimal format, depending on the precision and the value after rounding.

      • FLOATING_POINT_OR_SCIENTIFIC_UPPER_CASE

        public static final TextFormat.Conversion FLOATING_POINT_OR_SCIENTIFIC_UPPER_CASE
        The argument is formatted using computerized scientific notation (using an upper-case "E") or decimal format, depending on the precision and the value after rounding.

      • FLOATING_POINT_HEXADECIMAL

        public static final TextFormat.Conversion FLOATING_POINT_HEXADECIMAL
        The argument is formatted as a hexadecimal floating-point number with a significand and an exponent.

      • FLOATING_POINT_HEXADECIMAL_UPPER_CASE

        public static final TextFormat.Conversion FLOATING_POINT_HEXADECIMAL_UPPER_CASE
        The argument is formatted as an upper-case hexadecimal floating-point number with a significand and an exponent.

      • DATE_TIME

        public static final TextFormat.Conversion DATE_TIME
        The argument is formatted as a date and/or time, depending on the specified DateTimeConversion.

      • DATE_TIME_UPPER_CASE

        public static final TextFormat.Conversion DATE_TIME_UPPER_CASE
        The argument is formatted as an upper-case date and/or time, depending on the specified DateTimeConversion.

      • PERCENT

        public static final TextFormat.Conversion PERCENT
        The result is a literal "%" (\\u0025).

      • NEW_LINE

        public static final TextFormat.Conversion NEW_LINE
        The result is the platform-specific line separator.

      • getValidFlags

        public java.util.Set<TextFormat.FormatFlag> getValidFlags()
        Get the format flags which are valid for this conversion.
        Returns:
        this conversion's valid format flag.

      • allowsPrecision

        public boolean allowsPrecision()
        Determine whether this conversion allows precision or not.
        Returns:
        true if this conversion allows a precision, false otherwise.

      • getValidArgumentClasses

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Class<?>> getValidArgumentClasses()
        Get the set of classes whose instances can be used as arguments in formatting calls for this conversion.
        Returns:
        the set of classes which can be used as arguments with this conversion.

      • isValidArgument

        public boolean isValidArgument(java.lang.Object argument)
        Determine whether a given input is a valid argument for this conversion. i.e., whether or not a call to a formatting method using argument (e.g. System.out.printf(format,argument)) will throw an exception due to an invalid argument or not.
        Parameters:
        argument - The argument whose validity is being checked.
        Returns:
        true if the argument can be used with this conversion, false otherwise.

      • getTextFormatConversion

        public static TextFormat.Conversion getTextFormatConversion(char conversionCharacter)
        Get the conversion corresponding to a given character. If no conversion corresponds to the character, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        conversionCharacter - The character in question.
        Returns:
        the conversion corresponding to conversionCharacter.
